text: Johan Allan Edwall (25 August 1924 - 7 February 1997) was a Swedish actor, director, author, composer and singer. He appeared in some of Ingmar Bergman's movies such as Fanny and Alexander (1982). He was also known for starring in television movies based on the children's stories by Astrid Lindgren. He was also known for his role in Emil and the Piglet. He was born in Rödön, Sweden. Edwall died on 7 February 1997 in Stockholm of prostate cancer, aged 72. ==References== Category:1924 births Category:1997 deaths Category:Deaths from prostate cancer Category:Cancer deaths in Sweden Category:Swedish movie actors Category:Swedish television actors Category:Swedish stage actors Category:Swedish writers Category:Swedish composers Category:Swedish movie directors
title: Allan Edwall
